page.title: 12Larches House
page.content: Larches House was built in 1837 as the private home of a local mill owner.The most prominent citizen to own it was Edmund Birley,the Guild Mayor of 1882 and Lord Lieutenant of Lancashire. In 1939 the house was requisitioned by the Army as a Military Police H.Q. After the war in 1946 it was sold to Preston Corporation who used the land to build the Larches housing estate and the house as a Childrens Home. Today the house is used as a Special Residential School for about 30 children aged between 6-16 with learning and emotional difficulties. There is also ,a day unit for about 8 Phobic children who are unable to face normal schools ,and an office for the local Educational Psychologists.
